data.question: What is it?
data.answer: Fotrino is a photo gallery, social sharing site, and photo management tool.

data.question: Can I login without authenticating via a social media site?
data.answer: Fotrino is intentionally designed not to have a native registration and authentication system and instead relies on an Oauth 2 provider.  If you'd like to self host, you can set up an Ory Hydra server.  I've included a mock-server with the source code to help people get started quickly.

data.question: Can I edit photos?
data.answer: Not yet.  I'm evaluating the best way to support this.

data.question: Are there any keyboard shortcuts?
data.answer: Not yet and I realise this is really annoying.

data.question: Can I bulk import photos?
data.answer:
Not yet, but this is a really important feature to me. There are three supporting pieces of work for this:
  • Document the API
  • Add the ability to generate an API token
  • Provide a bash script that will recursively scan a folder and re-create the folder structure as albums and upload photos
All three items are planned.

data.question: I have similar photos, but they're not being found.
data.answer: There are lots of ways to play around with the hashing algorithm. If you want, you can send me the photos for testing.

data.question: My thumbnails aren't loading.
data.answer: Thumbnails are generated asynchronously and, depending on server load, might not be available right away. The frontend will attempt to reload the photo automatically.

data.question: What file types are supported?
data.answer: Jpg/jpeg and some RAW formats.  Let me know if you have a request.

data.question: Does Fotrino work on mobile?
data.answer: It should! Let me know if you have any issues.
